intro: Chilocarpus costatus var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean ironwood, is a rare and woody shrub native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark-colored wood and small, elliptical leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by yellowish berries that contain a single seed. It is known for its high density and durability, making it valuable for traditional craftsmanship.
